hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Kurayb ibn Fatik: He came to the Prophet ﷺ, and the Prophet ﷺ said to him: "O Kurayb, if it were not for two flaws in you, you would be the man!" His son Ayman ibn Kurayb was a poet, horseman, and noble person.

hadiths.english_translation: The name of al-Azwar is Malik ibn Aws ibn Judhaimah ibn Rabi'ah ibn Malik ibn Malik ibn Tha'labah ibn Dudan ibn Asad ibn Khuzaymah. He was a horseman and accepted Islam. He narrated from the Prophet ﷺ the hadith of al-Laquuh: 'Leave the call of milk.' Darar ibn al-Azwar fought on the day of al-Yamama with the fiercest fighting until both his legs were cut off completely. Then he crawled on his knees while fighting, and the horses trampled him, until death overcame him. Muhammad ibn Umar said: Darar ibn al-Azwar remained wounded at al-Yamama before Khalid ibn al-Walid departed by one day, then he died. He had recited his poem which began with the letter Meem. Muhammad ibn Umar said: This is more confirmed to us than other [versions].

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Tariq ibn Abdullah al-Muharabi: I was in the market of Dhu al-Majaz when a young man passed by me wearing a red striped cloak, saying: 'O people, say there is no deity except Allah and you will prosper!' A man behind him was throwing stones at him, having bloodied his heels and legs, saying: 'He is a liar, do not obey him!' I asked: 'Who is this?' They said: 'A boy from Bani Hashim who claims to be the Messenger of Allah, and this is his uncle Abd al-Uzza.' Later, when Muhammad ﷺ migrated to Madinah and people accepted Islam, we traveled from al-Rabadhah with a lady from our group. When we reached Madinah's outskirts, we changed our clothes. A man on the road asked us where we were from and where we were going. We told him we wanted to buy dates. He asked if we would sell our red camel. We agreed to a price in dates. He took the camel and left. We were worried, saying we had made a bad deal. A woman sitting with us said: 'I saw a man whose face was like a slice of the full moon's light. He will not wrong you or betray you, and I guarantee payment for your camel.' A man came and said: 'I am the Messenger of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. Here are your dates. Eat, be satisfied, and measure.' We ate, measured, took full measure, and were satisfied.

hadiths.english_translation: [Continuation of hadith 90321] We then entered Madinah and went to the mosque where he was preaching on the pulpit. We heard him saying: 'Give charity, for charity is better for you. The upper hand is better than the lower hand. Begin with those you are obligated to support: your mother, your father, your sister, your brother, then those nearest to you, then those nearest.' A man from Bani Yarbu' entered. A man from the Ansar stood and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, the Bani Yarbu' killed one of our men in the time of ignorance. Give us retaliation!' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'No mother inherits the burden of her child, no mother inherits the burden of her child' - three times.
